h2.span: A School As Unique As You Are

div.p: The traditional approach to high school just doesnâ€™t work for a lot of Springfield area students.
Thatâ€™s why we designed a high school as unique as you are. Cliff Park High School is different from other schools.

ul.li: A safe school environment without all the drama
Caring teachers focused on helping you graduate
The chance to work at your own pace so you can catch up or even graduate early
Flexible classes that work around your schedule
Job training so you can get a diploma AND a career

a.span: Last, but certainly not least in our intro of new

img.alt: Last, but certainly not least in our intro of new staff is someone who is only sort of new. Ms. Inman is joining us full-time to teach Healthcare classes! She has a wealth of experience working in the Healthcare industry as well as teaching students how to be STNAs. We're very excited to have her on our team!

a.span: New staff part 3! Ms. McCarthy is joining us all

img.alt: New staff part 3! Ms. McCarthy is joining us all the from Ireland this year to teach Science! She has been teaching for 5 years and is very excited to begin working with all of our students!

a.span: Next up for new staff is Mr. Watts who will be hel

img.alt: Next up for new staff is Mr. Watts who will be helping us out with security this year! Hi Yall!Â My name is Brian Watts and I am the School Resource Officer here at Cliff Park. I am well traveled, having lived all over the world.Â I have recently moved here from Texas where I was a civilian police officer at a military training base servicing approximately 3,000 students annually and a daily population of 9,000 people.Â I am excited to work at Cliff Park High School and welcome the opportunity to continue serving alongside the great team of educators, administrators, and support personnel.

a.span: Meet our new staff! First up is Mr. Gilrmore who i

img.alt: Meet our new staff! First up is Mr. Gilrmore who is joining us to teach Math. I was born and raised in Akron. Ohio. Though I have moved around a lot, I always find my way back Ohio. I received my Bachelorâ€™s degree in math education at Kent State University, and am very fortunate to begin my second year of teaching here at Cliff Park. In my spare time I enjoy watching television, reading, hiking, playing video games, and playing with my cats. Math is a huge passion of mine, and I love trying to get others to understand and appreciate it as well!

img.alt: Mr. Cole has his game face on for today's wiffleball game. See you all at 10:00 for game #1!

div.p: We know that every student learns differently. Our approach is to understand what each student needs to succeed and help them chart a path to graduation and a clear career path.
Our school is a proud member of Oakmont Education, a network of schools committed to reengaging youth and empowering them to make real, lasting changes in their lives.
